payload.content: x-cli is a command-line interface (CLI) tool designed for use with AI agents like Claude Code, Codex, OpenClaw, or OpenCode, and is not a Master Control Program (MCP), meaning it does not consume context space when inactive.

name: x-cli is a command-line interface (CLI) tool designed for use with AI agents lik
content: x-cli is a command-line interface (CLI) tool designed for use with AI agents like Claude Code, Codex, OpenClaw, or OpenCode, and is not a Master Control Program (MCP), meaning it does not consume context space when inactive.

payload.content: To set up x-cli in an agent session, paste the command: "Setup https://github.com/Infatoshi/x-cli".

name: To set up x-cli in an agent session, paste the command: "Setup https://github.co
content: To set up x-cli in an agent session, paste the command: "Setup https://github.com/Infatoshi/x-cli".

payload.content: x-cli provides commands for interacting with Twitter (or X) across several categories: Post (tweet post, reply, quote, delete), Read (tweet get, search, user timeline, mentions), Users (user get, followers, following), Engage (like, retweet), Bookmarks (me bookmarks, bookmark, unbookmark), and Analytics (tweet metrics).

name: x-cli provides commands for interacting with Twitter (or X) across several categ
content: x-cli provides commands for interacting with Twitter (or X) across several categories: Post (tweet post, reply, quote, delete), Read (tweet get, search, user timeline, mentions), Users (user get, followers, following), Engage (like, retweet), Bookmarks (me bookmarks, bookmark, unbookmark), and Analytics (tweet metrics).

payload.content: x-cli commands that require a tweet identifier can accept either the full tweet URL (e.g., https://x.com/user/status/123) or just the numerical tweet ID (e.g., 123).

name: x-cli commands that require a tweet identifier can accept either the full tweet
content: x-cli commands that require a tweet identifier can accept either the full tweet URL (e.g., https://x.com/user/status/123) or just the numerical tweet ID (e.g., 123).
